newsitem.title: USA: US mortgage-backeds slip, narrow in light trade.
newsitem.headline: US mortgage-backeds slip, narrow in light trade.

text.p: U.S. mortgage-backed securities slid lower on the heels of a dip in Treasuries prices during very light trading on Wednesday afternoon, traders said.
Late on Wednesday, pass-throughs were off 1/32 to 7/32 overall and spreads were one or two basis points tighter to Treasuries yields.
"It has been a low-volatility market, which is positive for mortgage paper," one trader said.
The 30-year bond dipped dipped further, off 17/32 in mid-afternoon trade before rebounding slightly to off 14/32.
"We tend to tighten in a down move," one trader said of mortgage backeds.
Late on Wednesday, GNMA 30-year 7.5 percent coupons were off 3/32 at 99-08/32, yielding 108 basis points over 10-year Treasuries.
Comparable FNMAs were off 4/32 at 99-04/32. And FHLMC 30-year 7.5 percent pass-throughs were off 5/32 at 99-07/32.

The market could stay range-bound through the rest of August, traders and fixed-income analysts said. The next important data should be the August employment report, set for release September 6, they said.
